There is another up-and-coming organization that everyone needs to be on the look out for. [YOUTH GAMING LEAGUE](http://www.yglhub.com).

We will be hosting tournaments for high school teams where the prize funds will be awarded to a College Savings Account. So you play League and could potentially pay your own way to college. There is no fee to play and win or lose your team earns money! So come and check us out on Facebook and Twitter - https://www.facebook.com/yglhub  -  https://twitter.com/ygltw

WWW.YGLHUB.COM

No we are yet supported by RIOT but with your help we hope to achieve that goal soon. 

SEE YOU ON THE RIFT! - GLHF

I posted this as a stand alone comment, but I may as well post it where someone might read it too.

I'm concerned for Riot collaborating with an organization like the CSL.

We won money (top 8) in their tournament last year and never received funds from them. The CEO Xeris is either incompetent or more likely a liar. I used to volunteer for CSL, and at the time he lied to everyone at staff meetings about not getting money from Azubu. He blamed Azubu saying that they never paid CSL so he can't pay any of the teams, and asked us to not indulge questions about prizepools.

Xeris went on Reddit right after the summer (literally days after telling us that he had never been paid) and said "The prize money from last season was paid in full" during an AMA.

http://www.reddit.com/r/CSL/comments/1rfw31/im_the_ceo_of_csl_feel_free_to_ama_about_csl_in/

Seriously Riot should not work with these crooks! many people working for CSL are volunteers kept in the dark (like I used to be), and I don't mean to offend anyone, but they are NOT a reputable organization.
Out of all posts, why does this one not have a reply...

Victorious Gaming is pretty much a solo queue tournament; you go in alone, get matched with 4 other people at your skill level, and play as a team vs other people of the same skill level.

The whole operation is run through Teamspeak; their website is kinda useless.

I recommend trying them out. There's tons of RP to win, and it only takes about 3 wins in a row, like a promotion series.
